Element Descriptions

An elementRefers to only valid elements tags is an individual component of an documentRefers to a hypertext documentwhich is ultimately a web page. is composed of a tree of elements and other nodes such as text nodes Contentan zone documentEach element can have attributes specifiedElements attributes and attribute values in are defined to have certain meanings semanticsFor example the ol element representsterminologyan zone document an ordered list and the lang attribute representsterminologyan zone document the language of the content.

Using what I have read and researched I have complied my own list of all the standard elements and Global Attributes from the following three websites: the web hypertext application
technology working group
www.whatwg.org – Living Standard Web Developers editionA technical specification for Web developersdevelopers.whatwg.org/ w3cworld wide web
consortium
www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/ and also the MDNMozilla Developer Network Element List
developer.mozilla.org website where notedHere I have listed only valid elements and attributes that will validate using the w3cworld wide web
consortium Markup Validate by uri
validator.w3.org/#validate_by_uriValidation Service and/or the Validator.nu (x)html5 Validator Living ValidatorThe only elements you should use in new websites are listed hereWhere you see the    image will indicate that element is a new feature added to Some elements listed here marked as changed have been modified or extended in their meaning by the new specifications.

This list by no means has everything that you will find in the specifications that I have referenced Just some major points and highlights These elements are listed by function/structure.

The

Description:

A is a required preamble

s are required for legacy reasonsWhen omitted browsers tend to use a different rendering mode that is incompatible with some specificationsIncluding the in a document ensures that the browser makes the best-effort attempt at following all relevant specifications.

For the purposes of generators that cannot output markup with the short ; A legacy string may be inserted into the in the position — and must consist exactly as defined in the obsolete permitted doctypesAn Zone Document section.

The html declaration must be the very first thing in your documentTerminologyAn Zone Document before the html tag.

The html declaration is not an tag but a Declaration instructing the web browser what version of the page has been written.

In the html declaration refers to a document type definition because was based on sgmlStandard Generalized Markup Languageused for defining generalized markuplanguages for documents.The specifies the rules for the markup language so that the browsers render the content correctly.

document type definition defines the legal building blocks of an documentIt defines the document structure with a list of legal elements and attributesIt is a set of markup declarations that define a document type for an sgmlfamily markup. language sgml is not based on sgml so therefore does not require the reference to a in its .

Always add the declaration to your documents so that the browser knows how to display and handle the document you are presenting.

Document title

title description :

Document titletitle description :

The title element representsterminologyan zone document the documents title or nameAuthors should use titles that identify their documents even when they are used out of context for example in a users history or bookmarks or in search results

The documents title is often different from its first heading since the first heading does not have to stand alone when taken out of context

There must be no more than one title element per document.

title

tags & attributesan zone document only!

howeversome have no real effect.

The title element is a “required childtags & attributesan zone document” in most situations but when a higher-level protocol provides title information e.g. in the Subject line of an e-mail when is used as an e-mail authoring format the title element can be omitted

If its reasonable for the Documentterminologyan zone document to have no title then the title element is probably not requiredSee the head elements content modelelement specificationsan zone document for a description of when the element is required.

title . text=value

Returns the contents of the element ignoring child nodes that arent Text nodes.

Can be set to replace the elements children with the given value.

Document Base

base description :

base description :

The base element allows authors to specify the document base terminologyan zone document for the purposes of resolving relative sterminologyan zone document and the name of the default browsing contextElement Extrasan zone document for the purposes of following hyperlinksElement Extrasan zone documentThe element does not representterminologyan zone document any content beyond this information.

There must be no more than one base element per document.

A base element must have either an href attribute a target attribute or both.

base

tags & attributesan zone documenthoweversome have no real effect

hreftags & attributesan zone documentDocument base

The href content attribute if specified must contain a valid potentially surrounded by spacesterminologyan zone document

A base element if it has an href attribute must come before any other elements in the tree that have attributes defined as taking uniform resource locators except the html element because its manifestTags And Attributesan zone document attribute isnt affected by base elements.

targettags & attributesan zone documentDefault browsing context for hyperlink navigation and form submissionElement Extrasan zone document

The target attribute if specified must contain a valid browsing context name or keywordElement Extrasan zone document which specifies which browsing contextElement Extrasan zone document is to be used as the default when hyperlinksElement Extrasan zone document and forms in the Documentterminologyan zone document cause navigation.

A base element if it has a target attribute must come before any elements in the tree that represent hyperlinksElement Extrasan zone document.

If there are multiple base elements with href attributes all but the first are ignored.

Document resourse link

link description :

Document linklink description :

Short and sweet – A link is the connection between one hypertext document and anotherThe link element allows authors to link their document to other resources.

The destination of each link is given by the hrefhypertext Reference attribute which must be present and must contain a valid potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone documentIf the href attribute is absent then the element does not define a link.

A link element must have either a relElement Extrasan zone document attribute or an itempropTag & Attributesan zone document attribute but not both.

The types of link indicatedthe relationshipsare given by the value of the rel attribute which if present must have a value that is a set of space-separated tokensElement Extrasan zone documentThe allowed keywords and their meanings are defined hereElement Extrasan zone document.

Two categories of links can be created using the link elementLinks to external resourcesElement Extrasan zone document and hyperlinksElement Extrasan zone documentThe link typesElement Extrasan zone document section defines whether a particular link type is an external resource or a hyperlink.

One link element can create multiple links of which some might be external resourceElement Extrasan zone document links and some might be hyperlinksElement Extrasan zone document exactly which and how many links are created depends on the keywords given in the rel attributeUser agents must process the links on a perlink basis not a perelement basis

The exact behavior for links to external resources depends on the exact relationship as defined for the relevant link typeElement Extrasan zone documentSome of the attributes control whether or not the external resourceElement Extrasan zone document is to be applied

link

tags & attributesan zone document

hreftags & attributesan zone documentAddress of the hyperlink

Specifies the of the linked resourseThe may either be relative or absolute

crossorigintags & attributesan zone documentHow the element handles crossorigin requests

A cors settings attributeElement Extrasan zone documentIt is intended for use with external resource links

reltags & attributesan zone documentRelationship between the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource

See link typesElement Extrasan zone document

mediatags & attributesan zone documentApplicable media

Specifies which media the resource applies toThe value must be a valid media queryterminologyan zone document

The default if the media attribute is omitted is all meaning that by default links apply to all media

hreflangtags & attributesan zone documentLanguage of the linked resource

Semantics for the link element are the same as the hreflang attributeElement Extrasan zone document on a and area elements

typetags & attributesan zone documentHint for the type of the referenced resource

Gives the mime type of the linked resourceIt is purely advisoryThe value must be a valid mime typeterminologyan zone document

For external resource links the type attribute is used as a hint to user agents so that they can avoid fetching resources they do not support

sizestags & attributesan zone documentSizes of the icons (for rel="icon")

The sizes attribute is used with reliconElement Extrasan zone documentThe attribute must not be specified on link elements that do not have a rel attribute that specifies the icon keyword

Also the titletags & attributesan zone document attribute has special semantics on this elementTitle of the link alternative style sheet set name

If the rel attribute is used the element is restricted to the head elementWhen used with the itemprop attribute the element can be used both in the head element and in the body of the page subject to the constraints of the microdata modelElement Extrasan zone document. Each link created for a link element is handled separatelyFor instance if there are two link elements with relstylesheet they each count as a separate external resource and each is affected by its own attributes independentlySimilarly if a single link element has relnext stylesheet it creates both a hyperlink keywordnext and an external resource link keywordstylesheet and they are affected by other attributes such as media or title differently Hyperlinks created with the link element and its rel attribute apply to the whole pageThis contrasts with the rel attribute of a and area elements which indicates the type of a link whose context is given by the links location within the document The title attribute on link elements differs from the global title attribute of most other elements in that a link without a title does not inherit the title of the parent element it merely has no title

More information on the link element

Various document metadata

meta description :

Various document metadatameta description :

The meta element representsterminologyan zone document various kinds of metadata that canot be expressed using the title base link style and script elements.

The meta element can represent documentlevel metadata with the name attribute pragma directives with the httpequiv attribute and the files character encoding declarationElement Extrasan zone document when an document is serialised to string form e.g. for transmission over the network or for disk storage with the charset attribute.

Exactly one of the name http-equiv charset and itemprop attributes must be specified.

meta

tags & attributesan zone document

nametags & attributesan zone documentMetadata name

The name attribute sets document metadataDocument metadata is expressed in terms of namevalue pairs

The name specifies what aspect of metadata is being set; valid names and the meaning of their values are described in the Standard Metadata NamesElement Extrasan zone document section

httpequivelement extrasan zone documentPragma directive

When the httpequiv attribute is specified on a meta element the element is a pragma directive

contenttags & attributesan zone documentValue of the element

If either name httpequiv or itemprop is specified then the content attribute must also be specified. Otherwise it must be omitted.

The content attribute gives the value of the document metadata or pragma directive when the element is used for those purposesThe allowed values depend on the exact context as described in subsequent sections

The content attribute gives the value of the of the meta element that also has a name httpequiv or itemprop attributeIf a meta element has no content attribute then the value part of the metadata namevalue pair is the empty stringterminologyan zone document

charsettags & attributesan zone documentCharacter encoding declaration

Specifies the character encoding used by the documentThis is a character encoding declarationElement Extrasan zone document

There must not be more than one meta element with a charset attribute per document.

If the attribute is present in an document its value must be an caseinsensitive matchterminologyan zone document for the string 8 forcing the document to use 8 as its encodingAllowed only to facilitate migration to and from xhtml

More information on the meta element

style description :

style description :

The style element allows authors to embed style information in their documentsThe style element is one of several inputs to the styling processing modelThis element does not representterminologyan zone document content for the user.

style

tags & attributesan zone document

mediatags & attributesan zone documentApplicable media

The media attribute says which media the styles apply toThe value must be a valid media queryterminologyan zone document.

The default if the media attribute is omitted is mediaall meaning that by default styles apply to all media.

typetags & attributesan zone documentType of embedded resource

The type attribute gives the styling languageIf the attribute is present its value must be a valid mime typeterminologyan zone document that designates a styling languageThe charset parameter must not be specifiedThe default value for the type attribute which is used if the attribute is absent would be typetext/css.

noncetags & attributesan zone documentCryptographic nonce used in Content Security Policy checks csp

Representsterminologyan zone document a cryptographic nonce number used once which can be used by Content Security PolicyContent Security Policy Level 3w3c.github.io/webappsec-csp/ to determine whether or not the style specified by an element will be applied to the documentThe value is text

scopedtags & attributesan zone documentWhether the styles apply to the entire document or just the parent subtree

The scoped attribute is a boolean attributeterminologyan zone documentIf present it indicates that the styles are intended just for the subtreeterminologyan zone document rooted at the style elements parent elementtags & attributesan zone document as opposed to the whole Documentterminologyan zone document.

A style element without a scoped attribute is restricted to the head element of the current document.

Also the titletags & attributesan zone document attribute has special semantics on this element: Alternative style sheet set name

Specifications do not specify a certain style system although is expected to be supported by most Web browsers

ELEMENT description :

ELEMENT description :

The body element representsterminologyan zone document the content of the document.

In conforming documents there is only one body elementThe document.body attribute provides scripts with easy access to a document's body element.

Some document object model operations for example parts of the drag and drop model are defined in terms of "the body elementThis is the first child of the element"This refers to a particular element in the document object model as per the definition of the term and not any arbitrary body element.

The body element exposes as event handler content attributestags & attributesan zone document a number of the event handlerstags & attributesan zone document of the WindowElement Extrasan zone document objectIt also mirrors their event handler attributes.

The onblur onerror onfocus onload onresize and onscroll eevent handlerstags & attributesan zone document of the WindowElement Extrasan zone document object exposed on the body element replace the generic event handlerstags & attributesan zone document with the same names normally supported by elementsterminologyan zone document.

An example would be: a bubbling errortags & attributesan zone document event dispatched on a childtags & attributesan zone document of the body elementterminologyan zone document of a Documentterminologyan zone document would first trigger the onerrortags & attributesan zone document event handler content attributestags & attributesan zone document of that element then that of the root html element and only then would it trigger the “onerror” “event handler content attribute” on the body elementThis is because the event would bubble from the target to the body to the html to the “Document” to the WindowElement Extrasan zone document and the event handlertags & attributesan zone document on the body is watching the “Window” not the bodyA regular event listener attached to the body using addEventListener however would be run when the event bubbled through the body and not when it reaches the WindowElement Extrasan zone document object.

 article description :

description :

Description:

The article element representsterminologyan zone document a complete or selfcontained composition in a document page application or site and that is in principle independently distributable or reusable in syndicationThis could be a forum post a magazine or newspaper article a blog entry a usersubmitted comment an interactive widget or gadget or any other independent item of contentEach article should be identified as sectioning content ContentAn Zone Document typically by including an h2—h6 heading element ContentAn Zone Document as a childtags & attributesan zone document of the article element.

When article elements are nested the inner article elements represent articles or sections that are in principle related to the contents of the outer articleFor instance a blog entry on a site that accepts usersubmitted comments could represent the comments as article elements nested within the article element for the blog entry.

Author information associated with an article element the address element does not apply to nested article elements.

When used specifically with content to be redistributed in syndication the article element is similar in purpose to the entry element in AtomThe Atom Syndication Format,M. Nottingham, R. Sayre. IETF.tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287.

When the main content of the page not including footers headers nav and aside is all one single selfcontained composition that content may be marked with an article but it is technically redundant in that case since its selfevident that the page is a single composition as it is a single document.

The article element is not a generic container elementWhen an element is needed only for styling purposes or as a convenience for scripting authors are encouraged to and should use the divelement instead.

A “general rule” is that the article element is appropriate only if the element's contents would be listed explicitly in the document's outline.

The “general rule” for both the article and section elements are the sameThen “Which One Should I Useelement descriptionsan zone document”?

More information on the article element

 section description :

description :

Description:

The section element representsterminologyan zone document a generic section of a document or applicationA section in this context is a thematic grouping of contentEach section should be identified as sectioning content ContentAn Zone Document typically by including an h2—h6 heading element ContentAn Zone Document

Examples of sections would be chapters the various tabbed pages in a tabbed dialog box or the numbered sections of a thesisA Web site's home page could be split into sections for an introduction news items and contact information.

Authors are encouraged to use the article element instead of the section element when it would make sense to syndicate the contents of the element. The section element is not a generic container elementWhen an element is needed only for styling purposes or as a convenience for scripting authors are encouraged to and should use the divelement instead.

A “general rule” is that the section element is appropriate only if the element's contents would be listed explicitly in the document's outline.

The “general rules” for both the article and section elements are the sameThen "Which One Should I UseAn Zone Document"?

 nav description :

description :

Description:

The nav element representsterminologyan zone document a navigational section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links.

In cases where the content of a nav element representsterminologyan zone document a list of items use list markup to aid understanding and navigation.

Not all groups of links on a page need to be in a nav elementIt is primarily intended for sections that consist of major navigation blocksIn particular it is common for footer to have a short list of links to various pages of a site such as the terms of service the home page and a copyright pageThe footer element alone is sufficient for such cases; while a nav element can be used in such cases it is usually unnecessary and not recommended.

User agents such as screen readers that are targeted at users who can benefit from navigation information being omitted in the initial rendering or who can benefit from navigation information being immediately available can use this element as a way to determine what content on the page to initially skip or provide on request or both.

More information on the nav element

 aside description :

description :

Description:

The aside element representsterminologyan zone document a section of a page that consists of content that is tangentially related to the content around the aside element and which could be considered separate from that contentSuch sections are often represented as sidebars in printed typography.

The aside element can be used for typographical effects like pull quotes or sidebars for advertising for groups of nav elements and for other content that is considered separate from the page main content.

It is not appropriate to use the aside element for any parentheticals since those are part of the content main flow.

More information on the aside element

h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 and h6 description :

description :

Description:

These elements represent headings for their sections.

The semantics and meaning of these elements are defined in the section on headings and sectionsAn Zone Document found in the Content page.

These elements have a rank given by the number in their nameThe h1 element is said to have the highest rank the h6 element has the lowest rank and two elements with the same name have equal rank. Previous Location!

Subheadings Subtitles Alternative Titles and Taglines

Instructional

As there are two different specifications:  : Living Standard Specification
html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/ and w3c Working Draftw3c Specification
www.w3.org/TR/html51/ there are two different schools of thought on how to markup Subheadings Subtitles Alternative Titles and Taglines.

  • The does not address this issuenext section because in their specs resides the hgroup element which is what it was created for
  • The w3c specification readssection below: “ does not have a dedicated mechanism for marking up subheadings alternative titles or taglines”

More information on the h1-h6 element

 hgroup description :

description :

Description:

The hgroup element representsterminologyan zone document the heading of a section which consists of all the h1>–<h6 element children of the hgroup elementThe element is used to group a set of h1>–<h6 elements when the heading has multiple levels such as “subheadings” “alternative titles” or “taglines”.

The rankh1>–<h6element descriptionan zone document of an hgroup element is the rank of the highestranked h1>–<h6 element descendant of the hgroup element if there are any such elements or otherwise the same as for an h1 element the highest rankOther elements of heading content ContentAn Zone Document in the hgroup element indicate “subheadings” or “subtitles”.

The section on headings and sections ContentAn Zone Document defines how hgroup elements are assigned to individual sections.

Continuing from the “The Reality Dysfunction” example:

“The Reality Dysfunction” is a book.

Think of the header as being “the book cover” and the h1 as being the “book title”.

But as it turns out that the first edition of “The Reality Dysfunction” has two titles.

There are other things on the book cover thoughThe author a quote from a review the publisher’s name.

Those things are paragraphs not headingsThat is why you might want to distinguish the headings from the other text on the headerThey're conceptually different.

Subheadings Subtitles Alternative Titles and Taglines

Instructional

As there are two different specifications:  : Living Standard Specification
html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/ and w3c Working Draftw3c Specification
www.w3.org/TR/html51/ there are two different schools of thought on how to markup Subheadings Subtitles Alternative Titles and Taglines.

  • The does not address this issuenext section because in their specs resides the hgroup element for what it was created for
  • The w3c specification readssection below: “ does not have a dedicated mechanism for marking up subheadings alternative titles or taglines”

Specification and validator
html5.validator.nu/ allows the use of the hgroup elementThis means using the hgroup element will not throw an .

When using the hgroup element only the first heading element participates in the document outline the generated Table of ContentsIn this case the h2 element does not participate in the document outline.

description :

more information. or Sectioning RootFollow the link for
more information elementA footer element typically contains information about its section such as who wrote it links to related documents copyright data and the like.

When the footer element contains entire sections they represent appendices indexes long colophons verbose license agreements and other such content.

Contact information for the author or editor of a section belongs in an address element possibly itself inside a footer elementBylines and other information that could be suitable for both a header or a footer can be placed in either or neitherThe primary purpose of these elements is merely to help the author write selfexplanatory markup that is easy to maintain and style; they are not intended to impose specific structures on authors.

Footers do not necessarily have to appear at the end of a section though they usually do.

Description:

Article or Section?

description :

A section forms part of something else. An article is its own thingBut how does one know which is which? Mostly the real answer is "it depends on author intent".

For example one could imagine a book with a "Granny Smith" chapter that just said "These juicy green apples make a great filling for apple pies." That would be a section because there'd be lots of other chapters on maybe other kinds of apples.

On the other hand, one could imagine a tweet or reddit comment or tumblr post or newspaper classified ad that just said "Granny SmithThese juicy green apples make a great filling for apple pies." It would then be an article because that was the whole thing.

A comment on an article is not part of the article on which it is commenting therefore it is on its own article.

p description :

description :

Description:

One of the most common tags in it denotes a paragraph contentan zone document of textIt often has other elements nested inside of it such as an img an a strong and em.

The p element representsterminologyan zone document a paragraph.

While paragraphs are usually represented in visual media by blocks of text that are physically separated from adjacent blocks through blank lines a style sheet or user agent would be equally justified in presenting paragraph breaks in a different manner for instance using inline pilcrows ¶.

The p element should not be used when a more specific element is more appropriate.

Some elements in particular ol and ul elements are two of the prohibited child elementsElement Extrasan zone document of the p elementWhen a sentence contains a bulleted list therefore one might wonder how it should be marked upThe solution is to realise that a paragraph in terms is not a “logical” concept but a “structural” one.

Authors wishing to conveniently style such “logical” paragraphs consisting of multiple “structural” paragraphs can use the div element instead of the p element.

More information on the p element

element : hr description :

description :

Description:

The hr element representsterminologyan zone document a paragraph-level thematic break e.g. a scene change in a story or a transition to another topic within a section of a reference book.

There is no need for an hr element between the sections themselves since the section elements and the heading h1 – h6 elements imply thematic changes themselves.

The hr element does not affect the document's outline.

Using can give the hr element some very stylistic presentations!

pre description :

description :

Description:

The pre element representsterminologyan zone document a block of preformatted text in which structure is represented by typographic conventions rather than by elements.

In the syntax a leading newline character immediately following the pre element start tagtags & attributesan zone document is stripped.

Authors are encouraged to consider how preformatted text will be experienced when the formatting is lost as will be the case for users of speech synthesizers braille displays and the likeFor cases like art it is likely that an alternative presentation such as a textual description would be more universally accessible to the readers of the document.

To represent a block of computer code the pre element can be used with a code element; to represent a block of computer output the pre element can be used with a samp elementSimilarly, the kbd element can be used within a pre element to indicate text that the user is to enter.

More information on the pre element

element : blockquote description :

description :

Description:

The blockquote element representsterminologyan zone document content that is quoted from another source.

Content inside a blockquote must be quoted from another source whose address if it has one may be cited in the cite attribute.

There is no formal method for indicating the markup in a blockquote is from a quoted source.

Content inside a blockquote other than citations and in-line changes must be quoted from another source whose address if it has one may be cited in the cite attribute.

If the cite attribute is present it must be a valid potentially surrounded by spacesterminologyan zone documentTo obtain the corresponding citation link the value of the attribute must be resolved relative to the elementUser agents may allow users to follow such citation links but they are primarily intended for private use e.g. by server-side scripts collecting statistics about a site’s use of quotations not for readers.

The cite attribute must reflect the elements cite content attribute.

The content of a blockquote may be abbreviated or may have context added in the conventional manner for the texts language.

Attribution for the quotation if any must be placed outside the blockquote element.

Using a blockquote element in conjunction with a figure element and its figcaption can clearly relate a quote to its attribution which is not part of the quote and therefore doesn’t belong inside the blockquote itself.

A forum post could use blockquote to show what post a user is replying toThe article element could be used for each post to mark up the threading.

It is not appropriate to use the cite and blockquote elements to markup a conversationExamples for this purpose are shown in this sectionElement Extrasan zone document.

More information on the blockquote element

ol description :

description :

Description:

The ol element representsterminologyan zone document a list of items where the items have been intentionally ordered such that changing the order would change the meaning of the document  —  unlike the ul elememt order does matter

The li element is the only childtags & attributesan zone document element allowed in the ol element in tree orderterminologyan zone document.

The reversed attribute is a boolean attributeterminologyan zone documentIf present it indicates that the list is a descending list ..., 3, 2, 1If the attribute is omitted the list is an ascending list 1, 2, 3, ....

The start attribute if present must be a valid integerterminologyan zone document giving the Ordinal valuethe list order1, 2, 3,…or in the case of a reversed order10, 9, 8,… of the first list item.

The type attribute can be used to specify the kind of marker to use in the list In cases where that matters items may need to be referenced by that markerHowever it seems to this author that using is a better approach.

The type attribute is easily overridden with .

li description :

description :

Description:

The li element representsterminologyan zone document a list itemIf its parenttags & attributesan zone document element is an ol ul or menu element then the element is an item of the parent elements list as defined for those elementsOtherwise the list item has no defined list-related relationship to any other li element.

If the parent element is an ol element then the li element has an Ordinal valuethe list order1, 2, 3,…or in the case of a reversed order10, 9, 8,….

The value attribute if present must be a valid integerterminologyan zone document giving the ordinal value of the list item.

While it is conforming to include heading elements ContentAn Zone Document h1> – <h6 inside li elements it likely does not convey the semantics that the author intendedA heading starts a new section so a heading in a list implicitly splits the list into spanning multiple sections. The li element is a “child only” ContentAn Zone Document element of the ul ol and menu elementsThe li element can not be a child of any other element.

dl description :

description :

Description:

The dl element representsterminologyan zone document an association list consisting of zero or more namevalue groups a description list.A namevalue group consists of one or more names dt elements followed by one or more valuesdd elements ignoring any nodes other than dt and dd elementsWithin a single dl element there should not be more than one dt element for each name.

Namevalue groups may be terms and definitions metadata topics and values questions and answers or any other groups of name-value data.

The values within a group are alternatives; multiple paragraphs forming part of the same value must all be given within the same dd element.

The order of the list of groups and of the names and values within each group may be significant.

The only elements alowed in a dl element are the dt and dd elements.

When a dl element doesn't match its content model it is often due to accidentally using dd elements in the place of dt elements and vice versaConformance checkers can spot such mistakes and might be able to advise authors how to correctly use the markup. The dl element is inappropriate and should not be used for marking up dialogueInstruction for this purpose are shown in this section ContentAn Zone Document.

More information on the dl element

 figure description :

description :

Description:

The figure element representsterminologyan zone document some Flow ContentFollow this link for more informationan zone document optionally with a caption that is self-contained like a complete sentence and is typically referenced as a single unit from the main flow of the document.

Selfcontained in this context does not necessarily mean independentFor example each sentence in a paragraph is selfcontained; an image that is part of a sentence would be inappropriate for a figure elementHowever an entire sentence made of images would be fitting. The element can thus be used to annotate illustrations diagrams photos code listings

When a figure is referred to from the main content of the document by identifying it by its caption by figure number it enables such content to be easily moved away from that primary content – to the side of the page to dedicated pages or to an appendix without affecting the flow of the document.

If a figure element is referenced by its relative position  –  “in the photograph above” or “as the next example illustrates” then moving the figure would disrupt the pages meaningAuthors are encouraged to consider using labels to refer to figures rather than using such relative references so that the page can easily be restyled without affecting the pages meaning.

The first figcaption element childtags & attributesan zone document of the element if any representsterminologyan zone document the caption or description of the figure elements contentsIf there is no child figcaption element then there is no caption.

A figure element's contents are part of the surrounding flowIf the purpose of the page is to display the figure for example a photograph on an image sharing site the figure and figcaption elements can be used to explicitly provide a caption for that figure.

For content that is only tangentially related or that serves a separate purpose than the surrounding flow the aside element should be used which can itself wrap a figure elementFor example a pull quote that repeats content from an article would be more appropriate in an aside than in a figure because it isn't part of the content it's a repetition of the content for the purposes of enticing readers or highlighting key topics.

More information on the figure element

 main description :

description :

author  Because there exists two different specifications there seems to be two different schools of thought for the main elementBoth descriptions are below with the differences color marked.

Description:

spec reads:

The main element can be used as a container for the dominant contents of another elementIt representsterminologyan zone document its children.

The main element is distinct from the section and article elements in that the main element does not contribute to the document outline ContentAn Zone Document. There is no restriction as to the number of main elements in a documentterminologyan zone documentIndeed there are many cases where it would make sense to have multiple main elementsFor example a page with multiple article elements might need to indicate the dominant contents of each such element.

w3c spec reads:

The main element representsterminologyan zone document the main content of the body of a document or application.

The main content area of a document includes content that is unique to that document and excludes content that is repeated across a set of documents such as site navigation links copyright information site logos and banners and search forms unless the document or applications main function is that of a search form.

Authors must not include more than one main element in a document.

Authors must not include the main element as a descendant of an article aside footer header or nav element.

The main element is not suitable for use to identify the main content areas of subsections of a document or applicationThe simplest solution is to not mark up the main content of a subsection at all and just leave it as implicit but an author could use a Grouping Content ContentAn Zone Document or Sectioning Content ContentAn Zone Document element as appropriate. The main element is not Sectioning Content ContentAn Zone Document. and has no effect on the document outline.

More information on the main element

div description :

description :

Description:

The div element has no special meaning at allIt representsterminologyan zone document its childrenIt can be used with the class lang and title attributes to mark up semantics common to a group of consecutive elements.

For instance a blog post would be marked up using article a chapter using section a page's navigation aids using nav and a group of form controls using fieldset.

On the other hand div elements can be useful for stylistic purposes or to wrap multiple paragraphs within a section that are all to be marked-up in a similar wayAn example would be using a div element as a way to set the language of two paragraphs at once instead of setting the language on the two paragraph elements separately.

Authors are strongly encouraged to view the div element as an element of last resort for when no other element is suitableUse of more appropriate elements instead of the div element leads to better accessibility for readers and easier maintainability for authors.

More information on the div element

element : a 

description :

Description:

If the a element has an href attribute then it representsterminologyan zone document a hyperlinkElement Extrasan zone document a hypertext anchor labeled by its contents.

If the a element has no href attribute then the element representsterminologyan zone document a placeholder for where a link might otherwise have been placed if it had been relevant consisting of just the element's contents.

The target download rel, hreflang and type attributes must be omitted if the href attribute is not present.

If the itemprop attribute is specified on an a element then the href attribute must also be specified.

More information on the a element

em description :

description :

Description:

The em element representsterminologyan zone document stress emphasis of its contents.

The level of stress that a particular piece of content has is given by its number of ancestortags & attributesan zone document em elements.

The placement of stress emphasis changes the meaning of the sentenceThe element thus forms an integral part of the contentThe precise way in which stress is used in this way depends on the language.

The em element is not a generic “italics” elementSometimes text is intended to stand out from the rest of the paragraph as if it was in a different mood or voiceFor this the i element is more appropriate. The em element also is not intended to convey importanceFor that purpose the strong element is more appropriate.

More information on the em element

strong description :

description :

Description:

The strong element representsterminologyan zone document strong importance seriousness or urgency for its contents.

Importance: The strong element can be used in a heading caption or paragraph to distinguish the part that really matters from other parts of the document that might be more detailed more jovial or merely boilerplate.

For example the first word of the previous paragraph and the following two paragraphs are marked up using the strong element to distinguish it from the more detailed text in the rest of each paragraph.

Seriousness: The strong element can be used to mark up a warning or caution notice.

Urgency: The strong element can be used to denote contents that the user needs to see sooner than other parts of the document.

The relative level of importance of a piece of content is given by its number of ancestor strong elements; each strong element increases the importance of its contents.

Changing the importance of a piece of text with the strong element does not change the meaning of the sentence.

The strong element is not a generic “bold” elementFor this purpose the b element would be more appropriate. The strong element alone will not give its contents a stress value an em element would be needed to convey any stress for the contents strongememstrong.

More information on the strong element

 Element : small description :

description :

Description:

The small element representsterminologyan zone document side comments such as small print.

The small element should not be used for extended spans of text such as multiple paragraphs lists or sections of textIt is only intended for short runs of textThe text of a page listing terms of use for instance would not be a suitable candidate for the small element: in such a case the text is not a side comment it is the main content of the page.

The small element must not be used for subheadingsFor that purpose use the hgroup element with appropriate heading elements ContentAn Zone Document.

Although the small element like the b and i elements may be thought of to violate the principle of separation between structure and presentation all three are valid in and have a semantic meaning not for presentationAuthors are encouraged to use their best judgement when determining whether to use small or .

Small print typically features disclaimers caveats legal restrictions or copyrightsSmall print is also sometimes used for attribution, or for satisfying licensing requirements. The small element does not “deemphasize” or lower the importance of text emphasized by the em element or marked as important with the strong element.

More information on the small element

cite description :

description :

Description:

The cite element representsterminologyan zone document a reference to a creative workIt must include the title of the work or the name of the author person people or organization or an reference or a reference in abbreviated form as per the conventions used for the addition of citation metadata.

Creative works include a book a paper an essay a poem a score a song a script a film a TV show a game a sculpture a painting a theatre production a play an opera a musical an exhibition a legal case report a computer program a web site a web page a blog post or comment a forum post or comment a tweet a written or oral statement etc. A citation is not a quote for which it should not  be used forFor quotes the q element is more appropriate.

More information on the cite element

q description :

description :

Description:

The q element representsterminologyan zone document some Phrasing Content ContentAn Zone Document quoted from another source.

The q Element or Quote Element indicates that the enclosed text is a short inline quotationThis element is intended for short quotations that do not require paragraph breaksLong quotations should be placed in the blockquote element.

Quotation punctuation such as quotation marks used for marking the contents of the element must not appear immediately before after or inside q elementsThey will be inserted into the rendering by the user agent.

Content inside a q element must be quoted from another source whose address if it has one may be cited in the cite attributeThe source may be fictional as when quoting characters in a novel or screenplay.

If the cite attribute is present it must be a valid potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone document.

The q element must not be used in place of quotation marks that do not represent a quoteFor example it is inappropriate to use the q element for marking up sarcastic statements.

The use of the q element to mark up quotations is entirely optionalUsing explicit quotation punctuation without using the q element is just as correct.

More information on the q element

dfn description :

description :

Description:

The dfn element representsterminologyan zone document the defining instance of a termThe paragraph ContentAn Zone Document description list group dl or section that is the nearest ancestortags & attributesan zone document of the dfn element must also contain the definitions for the term given by the dfn element.

Defining term: If the dfn element has a title attribute then the exact value of that attribute is the term being definedOtherwise if it contains exactly one element child node and no child Text nodes and that childtags & attributesan zone document element is an abbr element with a title attribute then the exact value of that attribute is the term being definedOtherwise it is the exact textContent of the dfn element that gives the term being defined.

If a dfn element has the title present then it must contain only the term being defined.

An a element that links to a dfn element representsterminologyan zone document an instance of the term defined by the dfn element.

The title attribute of ancestor elements does not affect dfn elements.

More information on the dfn element

abbr description :

description :

Description:

The abbr element representsterminologyan zone document an abbreviation or acronym optionally with an expansionThe title attribute may be used to provide an expansion of the abbreviationThe attribute if specified must contain an expansion of the abbreviation, and nothing else.

If an abbreviation is pluralized the expansions grammatical style plural vs singular must match the grammatical style of the contents of the element.

Abbreviations do not have to be marked up using this elementIt is expected to be useful in the following cases:
  • Abbreviations for which the author wants to give expansions where using the abbr element with a title attribute is an alternative to including the expansion inline in parentheses.
  • Abbreviations that are likely to be unfamiliar to the documents readers.
  • Abbreviations whose presence needs to be semantically explained so that they can be identified using to give the abbreviations specific styles.

Providing an expansion in a title attribute once will not necessarily cause other abbr elements in the same document with the same contents behave the sameEvery abbr element is independent.

More information on the abbr element

 ruby description :

description :

Description:

The ruby element allows one or more spans of Phrasing ContentFollow the link for
more information to be marked with ruby annotationsRuby annotations are short runs of text presented alongside base text primarily used in East Asian typography as a guide for pronunciation or to include other annotationsIn Japanese this form of typography is also known as furigana.

Ruby text can appear on either side and sometimes both sides of the base text and it is possible to control its position using .

The content model of ruby elements consists of one or more of the following sequences:
  • One or the other of the following:
  • Phrasing content but with no ruby elements and with no ruby element descendants.
  • A single ruby element that itself has no ruby element descendants.
  • One or the other of the following:
  • One or more rt elements.
  • An rp element followed by one or more rt elements, each of which is itself followed by an rp element.

The ruby and rt elements can be used for a variety of kinds of annotations including in particular though by no means limited to those described herefollow the “element extras”link below ⇓For more details on Japanese Ruby in particular and how to render Ruby for Japanese see Requirements for Japanese Text LayoutRequirements for Japanese Text Layoutw3c Working Group Note April 3, 2012www.w3.org/TR/jlreq/

At the time of writing does not yet provide a way to fully control the rendering of the ruby elementIt is hoped that will be extended to support the styles described herefollow the “element extras”link below ⇓ in due course. The only elements allowed within the ruby element are the rt rp and rtc elements.

More information on the ruby element

 rp description :

description :

Description:

The rp element can be used to provide parentheses or other content around a ruby text component of a ruby annotation to be shown by user agents that do not support ruby annotations.

The contents of the rp elements are typically not displayed by user agents which do support ruby annotations.

An rp element that is a childtags & attributesan zone document of a ruby element representsterminologyan zone document nothing. An rp element whose parenttags & attributesan zone document element is not a ruby element representsterminologyan zone document its children.

The rp element is a child only ContentAn Zone Document element and can only be used within the ruby or the rtc element.

More information on the rp element

 data description :

description :

Description:

The data element representsterminologyan zone document its contents along with a machine-readable form of those contents in the value attribute.

The value attribute must be presentIts value must be a representation of the element's contents in a machine-readable format.

When the value is date- or time-related the more specific time element can be used instead.

The element can be used for several purposes; When combined with microformats or the microdata attributesmicrodataan zone document defined in the specifications and in this website the element serves to provide both a machinereadable value for the purposes of data processors and a humanreadable value for the purposes of rendering in a Web browserIn this case the format to be used in the value attribute is determined by the microformats or microdata vocabulary in use. The element can also however be used in conjunction with scripts in the page for when a script has a literal value to store alongside a humanreadable valueIn such cases the format to be used depends only on the needs of the scriptThe data-* attributes can also be useful in such situations.

For example a short table has its numeric values encoded using the data element so that the table sorting modelElement Extrasan zone document can provide a sorting mechanism on each column despite the numbers being presented in textual form in one column and in a decomposed form in another.

More information on the data element

 time description :

description :

Description:

The time element representsterminologyan zone document its contents along with a machinereadable form of those contents in the datetime attributeThe kind of content is limited to various kinds of dates times timezone offsets and durations.

The datetime attribute may be presentIf present its value must be a representation of the elements contents in a machinereadable format.

A time element that does not have a datetime content attribute must not have any element descendants.

In other words the syntax for the time element is very specific.
  • The time element without the datetime attribute:
  • timeJuly 4, 2016time is not valid syntax
  • It must be formatted as such: time2016-07-04time
  • The time element with the datetime attribute:
  • time datetime2016-07-04July 4, 2016time is a valid syntax.
The valid time strings allowedElement Extrasan zone document

More information on the time element

code description :

description :

Description:

The code element representsterminologyan zone document a fragment of computer codeThis could be an , xml element name a file name a computer program or any other string that a computer would recognize.

There is no formal way to indicate the language of computer code being marked up. Authors who wish to mark code elements with the language used so that syntax highlighting scripts can use the right rules can use the class attribute e.g. by adding a class prefixed with language- classlanguage-pascal to the element.

An author can use the code element:
  • To represent a block of computer code:
  • The pre element can be used with a code element.
  • To represent a block of computer output:
  • The pre element can be used with a samp element.
  • To indicate text what the user is to enter:
  • The kbd element can be used within a pre element.

More information on the code element

var description :

description :

Description:

The var element representsterminologyan zone document a variableThis could be an actual variable in a mathematical expression or programming context an identifier representing a constant a symbol identifying a physical quantity a function parameter or just be a term used as a placeholder in prose.

For mathematics in particular for anything beyond the simplest of expressions mathmatical markup languagew3c specificationswww.w3.org/TR/MathML/ is more appropriateHowever the var element can still be used to refer to specific variables that are then mentioned in expressions.

More information on the var element

kbd description :

description :

Description:

The kbd element representsterminologyan zone document user input typically keyboard input although it may also be used to represent other input such as voice commands.

When the kbd element is nested inside a samp element it representsterminologyan zone document the input as it was echoed by the system.

When the kbd element contains a samp element it representsterminologyan zone document input based on system output for example invoking a menu item.

When the kbd element is nested inside another kbd element it representsterminologyan zone document an actual key or other single unit of input as appropriate for the input mechanism.

More information on the kbd element

sub  &sup description :

description :

Description:

The sub element representsterminologyan zone document a subscript and the sup element representsterminologyan zone document a superscript.

These elements must be used only to mark up typographical conventions with specific meanings not for typographical presentation for presentation's sakeFor example it would be inappropriate for the sub and sup elements to be used in the name of the LaTeX document preparation systemIn general authors should use these elements only if the absence of those elements would change the meaning of the content.

In certain languages superscripts are part of the typographical conventions for some abbreviations.

The sub element can be used inside a var element for variables that have subscripts.

Mathematical expressions often use subscripts and superscriptsAuthors are encouraged to use mathmatical markup languagew3c specificationswww.w3.org/TR/MathML/ for marking up mathematics but authors may opt to use sub and sup if detailed mathematical markup is not desired.

More information on the sub-sup element

 i description :

description :

Description:

The i element representsterminologyan zone document a span of text in an alternate voice or mood or otherwise offset from the normal prose in a manner indicating a different quality of text such as a taxonomic designation a technical term an idiomatic phrase from another language transliteration a thought or a ship name in Western texts.

Terms in different languages from the main text should contain lang attributes. In xml, lang attributestags & attributesan zone document in the namespaceElement Extrasan zone document.

Authors can use the class attribute on the i element to identify why the element is being used so that if the style of a particular use dream sequences as opposed to taxonomic terms is to be changed at a later date the author doesnt have to go through the entire document or series of related documents annotating each use.

Authors are encouraged to consider whether other elements might be more applicable than the i elementFor instance the em element for marking up stress emphasis or the dfn element to mark up the defining instance of a term.

can be used to format i elements just like any other element can be restyledThus it is not the case that content in i elements will necessarily be italicizedHowever the default property is font-style: italic;

More information on the i element

 b description :

description :

Description:

The b element representsterminologyan zone document a span of text to which attention is being drawn for utilitarian purposes without conveying any extra importance and with no implication of an alternate voice or mood such as key words in a document abstract product names in a review actionable words in interactive text-driven software or an article lede lead.

The b element would be appropriate to mark up the lede or lead sentence or paragraph.

As with the i element authors can use the class attribute on the b element to identify why the element is being used so that if the style of a particular use is to be changed at a later date the author doesnt have to go through annotating each use.

The b element should be used as a last resort when no other element is more appropriateIn particular;
  • headings should use the h1 to h6 elements
  • stress emphasis should use the em element
  • importance should be marked up with the strong element
  • text marked or highlighted should use the mark element

can be used to format b elements just like any other element can be restyledThus it is not the case that content in b elements will necessarily be boldenedHowever the default property is font-style: bold;

The b element should not be confused with the strong em or mark elementsThe b element does not convey such special semantic information.

More information on the b element

 u description :

description :

Description:

The u element representsterminologyan zone document a span of text with an unarticulated though explicitly rendered non-textual annotation such as labeling the text as being a proper name in Chinese text a Chinese proper name mark or labeling the text as being misspelt.

In most cases another element is likely to be more appropriate:

For marking stress emphasis the em element should be used.

For marking key words or phrases either the b element or the mark element should be used.

Depending on the context – For marking book titles the cite element should be used.

For labeling text with explicit textual annotations the ruby element should be used.

For labeling ship names in Western texts the i element should be used.

The default rendering of the u element in visual presentations clashes with the conventional rendering of hyperlinks underliningAuthors are encouraged to avoid using the u element where it could be confused for a hyperlink.

Using it could be styled with border-bottom2px solid rgb(0,0,255)unique style as desired

More information on the u element

 mark description :

description :

Description:

The mark element representsterminologyan zone document a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes due to its relevance in another context.

When used in a quotation or other block of text referred to from the prose it indicates a highlight that was not originally present but which has been added to bring the readers attention to a part of the text that might not have been considered important by the original author when the block was originally written but which is now under previously unexpected scrutiny.

When used in the main prose of a document it indicates a part of the document that has been highlighted due to its likely relevance to the users current activity.

The mark element can be used for highlighting parts of a document that are matching some search string.

More information on the mark element

br description :

description :

Description:

The br element representsterminologyan zone document a line break.

br elements must be used only for line breaks that are actually part of the content as in poems or addresses.

br elements must not be used for separating thematic groups in paragraphsThis is abuse and semanticly incorrect usage of the br elementIt is recommended as an alternative to use other Grouping Content ContentAn Zone Document to give the same visual effect.

If a paragraph consists of nothing but a single br element it representsterminologyan zone document a placeholder blank line as in a templateSuch blank lines must not be used for presentation purposes.

Any content inside br elements must not be considered part of the surrounding text.

While line breaks are usually represented in visual media by physically moving subsequent text to a new line a style sheet or user agent would be equally justified in causing line breaks to be rendered in a different manner for instance as green dots or as extra spacing.

More information on the br element

 wbr description :

description :

Description:

The wbr element representsterminologyan zone document a line break opportunity.

Especially long lines of code or long text links could have suggested wrapping points given using wbr elements.

The wbr element has no effect on bidirectional ordering.

The wbr element does not introduce a hyphen at the break pointIn order to create a hyphen only at the end of a line the soft hyphen character entity &shy; would be needed.

More information on the wbr element

 picture description :

description :

Description:

The picture element is a container which provides multiple sources to its contained img element to allow authors to declaratively control or give hints to the user agent about which image resource to use based on the screen pixel density viewport size image format and other factorsIt representsterminologyan zone document its children.

The picture element is somewhat different from the similar-looking video and audio elementsWhile all of them contain source elements the source element's src attribute has no meaning when the element is nested within a picture element and the resource selection algorithm is differentAs well the picture element itself does not display anything; it merely provides a context for its contained img element that enables it to choose from multiple s.

More information on the picture element

 source description :

description :

Description:

The source element allows authors to specify multiple alternative media resourcesElement Extrasan zone document for media elementsElement Extrasan zone documentIt does not representterminologyan zone document anything on its own.

The type attribute may be presentIf present the value must be a valid MIME typeterminologyan zone document.

The src attribute gives the address of the media resourceThe value must be a valid potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone documentThis attribute must be present.

Dynamically modifying a source element and its attribute when the element is already inserted in a video or audio element will have no effectTo change what is playing just use the src attribute on the media element directly possibly making use of the canPlayType method to pick from amongst available resourcesGenerally manipulating source elements manually after the document has been parsed is an unnecessarily complicated approach.

The type attribute gives the type of the media resource to help the user agent determine if it can play this media resource before fetching itIf specified its value must be a valid MIME typeterminologyan zone documentThe codecs parameterThe Codecs Parameter for“Bucket” Media Typestools.ietf.org/html/rfc4281 which certain mime types define might be necessary to specify exactly how the resource is encoded.

When used on media elements the srcset sizes and media attributes must not be present.

The source element has two different usesWhen found with the picture element as a parenttags & attributesan zone document there are different requirements. Please see Element Extrasfollow the “element extras”link below ⇓ for these requirements.

img description :

description :

Description:

An img element representsterminologyan zone document an image.

The image given by the src and srcset attributes and any previous sibling source elements srcset attributes if the parenttags & attributesan zone document is a picture element is the embedded content; the value of the alt attribute provides equivalent content for those who cannot process images or who have image loading disabled.  It is the img elements fallback content ContentAn Zone Document.

The requirements on the alt attributes value are described in this sectionElement Extrasan zone document.

The src attribute must be present and must contain a valid potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone document referencing a non-interactive optionally animated image resource that is neither paged nor scripted.

The srcset attribute may also be presentIf present its value must consist of one or more image candidate stringsElement Extrasan zone document each separated from the next by a comma u+002c characterIf an image candidate string contains no descriptors and no space charactersTerminologyan zone document after the the following image candidate string if there is one must begin with one or more space charactersTerminologyan zone document.

The img element must not be used as a layout toolIn particular img elements should not be used to display transparent images as such images rarely convey meaning and rarely add anything useful to the document.

More information on the img element

For iframe elements in documents the srcdoc attribute if present must have a value using the syntaxterminologyan zone document that consists of the following syntactic components in the given order:

  • Any number of commentscomment delimiter descriptionan zone document and space characters.
  • Optionally a declaration descriptionan zone document.
  • Any number of commentscomment delimiter descriptionan zone document and space characters.
  • The root elementterminologyan zone document in the form of an html element.
  • Any number of commentscomment delimiter descriptionan zone document and space characters.

 embed description :

description :

Description:

The embed element provides an integration point for an external typically non- application or interactive content ContentAn Zone Document.

The src attribute gives the address of the resource being embeddedThe attribute if present must contain a valid nonempty potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone document.

If the itemprop attribute is specified on an embed element then the src attribute must also be specified.

The type attribute if present gives the MIME typeterminologyan zone document by which the plugin to instantiate is selectedThe value must be a valid MIME typeterminologyan zone documentIf both the type attribute and the src attribute are present then the type attribute must specify the same type as the explicit ContentType metadata specshtml.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/infrastructure.html#content-type of the resource given by the src attribute.

Any namespaceless attribute may be specified on the embed element so long as its name is - compatibleterminologyan zone document and contains no uppercase lettersterminologyan zone documentThese attributes are then passed as parameters to the pluginterminologyan zone document.

All attributes in HyperText Markup LanguageRefers to the language itselfNOT any particular version documents are converted to lowercase automatically so the restriction on uppercase letters doesnt affect such documents.

The four exceptions are to exclude legacy attributes that have side-effects beyond just sending parameters to the plugin.

The embed element supports dimension attributesElement Extrasan zone document.

More information on the embed element

object description :

description :

Description:

The object can representterminologyan zone document an external resource which depending on the type of the resource will either be treated as an image as a nested browsing contextElement Extrasan zone document or as an external resource to be processed by a pluginterminologyan zone document.

The data attribute if present specifies the address of the resourceIf present the attribute must be a valid nonempty potentially surrounded by spaces Terminologyan zone document.

The type attribute if present specifies the type of the resourceIf present the attribute must be a valid mime typeterminologyan zone document.

At least one of either the data attribute or the type attribute must be present.

If the itemprop attribute is specified on an object element then the data attribute must also be specified.

usage warningAuthors who reference resources from other origins that they do not trust are urged to use the typemustmatch attribute defined belowWithout this attribute it is possible in certain cases for an attacker on the remote host to use the plugin mechanism to run arbitrary scripts even if the author has used features such as the Flash “allowScriptAccess” parameter. The typemustmatch attribute is a boolean attributeterminologyan zone document whose presence indicates that the resource specified by the data attribute is only to be used if the value of the type attribute and the Content-Type of the aforementioned resource match. The typemustmatch attribute must not be specified unless both the data attribute and the type attribute are present.

The name attribute if present must be a valid browsing context nameElement Extrasan zone documentThe given value is used to name the nested browsing contextElement Extrasan zone document if applicable.

The usemap attribute if present while the object element representsterminologyan zone document an image can indicate that the object has an associated image mapElement Extrasan zone document.

The form attribute is used to explicitly associate the object element with its form ownerElement Extrasan zone document.

The object element supports dimension attributeselement extrasan zone document.

More information on the object element

 video description :

description :

Description:

A video element is used for playing videos or movies and audio files with captions.

The video element is a media elementElement Extrasan zone document whose media dataElement Extrasan zone document is ostensibly video data possibly with associated audio data.

The src preload autoplay mediagroup loop muted and controls attributes are the attributes common to all media elements.

The poster attribute gives the address of an image file that the user agent can show while no video data is availableThe attribute if present must contain a valid nonempty potentially surrounded by spacesterminologyan zone document.

The image given by the poster attribute is intended to be a representative frame of the video typically one of the first nonblank frames that gives the user an idea of what the video is like.

video . videoWidth

video . videoHeight

These attributes return the intrinsic dimensions of the video or zero if the dimensions are not known.

The video element supports dimension attributesElement Extrasan zone document.

Content may be provided inside the video element; it is intended for older Web browsers which do not support video so that legacy video plugins can be tried or to show text to the users of these older browsers informing them of how to access the video contents.

In particular this content is not intended to address accessibility concernsTo make video content accessible to the partially sighted the blind the hard-of-hearing the deaf and those with other physical or cognitive disabilities a variety of features are availableCaptions can be provided either embedded in the video stream or as external files using the track elementSignlanguage tracks can be provided again either embedded in the video stream or by synchronizing multiple video elements using the mediagroup attribute or a MediaController objectAudio descriptions can be provided either as a separate track embedded in the video stream or a separate audio track in an audio element slaved to the same controller as the video elements or in text form using a W ebVTTThe Web Video Text Tracks Formatw3c.github.io/webvtt/ file referenced using the track element and synthesized into speech by the user agentW ebVTT can also be used to provide chapter titlesFor users who would rather not use a media element at all transcripts or other textual alternatives can be provided by simply linking to them in the prose near the video element.

More information on the video element

Element:   New Feature

menu 

Description:

The menu element has a bit of a troubled historyIn html3 it was pretty much the same as the ul elementIt was deprecated in HTML4 but re-introduced in HTML5. Due to feedback from browser makers it changed a bit between the publishing of the W3C HTML5 spec and the continued work on the WHATWG HTML5.1 spec.

Element:

noscript 

Description:

The noscript element representsterminologyan zone document nothing if scripting is enabled, and representsterminologyan zone document its children if scripting is disabled. It is used to present different markup to user agents that support scripting and those that don't support scripting, by affecting how the document is parsed. When used in HTML documents, the allowed content model is as follows: In a head element, if scripting is disabled for the noscript element The noscript element must contain only link, style, and meta elements. In a head element, if scripting is enabled for the noscript element The noscript element must contain only text, except that invoking the HTML fragment parsing algorithm with the noscript element as the context element and the text contents as the input must result in a list of nodes that consists only of link, style, and meta elements that would be conforming if they were children of the noscript element, and no parse errors. Outside of head elements, if scripting is disabled for the noscript element The noscript element's content model is transparent, with the additional restriction that a noscript element must not have a noscript element as an ancestor (that is, noscript can't be nested). Outside of head elements, if scripting is enabled for the noscript element The noscript element must contain only text, except that the text must be such that running the following algorithm results in a conforming document with no noscript elements and no script elements, and such that no step in the algorithm throws an exception or causes an HTML parser to flag a parse error: Remove every script element from the document. Make a list of every noscript element in the document. For every noscript element in that list, perform the following steps: Let s be the concatenation of all the Text node children of the noscript element. Set the outerHTML attribute of the noscript element to the value of s. (This, as a side-effect, causes the noscript element to be removed from the document.) [DOMPARSING]

All these contortions are required because, for historical reasons, the noscript element is handled differently by the HTML parser based on whether scripting was enabled or not when the parser was invoked. The noscript element must not be used in XML documents. The noscript element is only effective in the HTML syntax, it has no effect in the XHTML syntax. This is because the way it works is by essentially "turning off" the parser when scripts are enabled, so that the contents of the element are treated as pure text and not as real elements. XML does not define a mechanism by which to do this. The noscript element has no other requirements. In particular, children of the noscript element are not exempt from form submission, scripting, and so forth, even when scripting is enabled for the element.

Gecko

Gecko originally NGLayout is the layout engine developed by the Mozilla Project to read web content such as css xulxml user Interface language JavaScript and render it on the users screen or print itIn xul-based applications Gecko is used to render the applications user interface as well.

Gecko is primarily used in web browsers such as Firefox SeaMonkey etc. (for a complete list please refer to Wikipedias article on Geckoen.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gecko_(software)#Usage) that use this layout engineIt is also used in many applications such as Mozilla’s own Thunderbird email–client applicationProducts using the same version of Gecko have identical support for standards.
